subject: Leadership
title: Healthy vs. Unhealthy Conflict
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Healthy vs. Unhealthy Conflict.

hook.text: Two teams: one argues passionately about ideas, the other never disagrees. The arguers perform far better.

discovery.text: Lencioni argues that fear of conflict leads to artificial harmony, where real issues fester beneath the surface.

twist.text: Teams that avoid all conflict aren't peacefulâ€”they're stuck. Progress requires the friction of differing views.

climax.text: Leaders encourage healthy conflict by separating ideas from identities and praising those who challenge norms.

punchline.text: Harmony without honesty is just silence in disguise.

quiz.question: What distinguishes healthy conflict from unhealthy conflict?
options: Healthy conflict is about ideas; unhealthy is about people
